page.title: 16Henry the Town Crier
page.content: {Henry Howard}is the{Southwell}town crier. He has lived in{Southwell}for many years.He is 77 years old.Every Saturday morning he goes into the middle of the street,rings his bell (which is over a hundred years old) and shouts,{"Oh yea,oh yea,oh yea."} Everyone gathers round and hears what he has to say.Over the 32 years he has been town crier{he has raised Â£55,000 {for charity.}The traditional costume that he wears include a three pointed hat,red coat,green knee length shorts and black shoes with a buckle.{In 1977 {he got the Queen's Silver Jubilee {Medal and in 1984 he was presented {with some Maundy Money.}In the war he was a desert rat and he travelled to places like Cairo and Jerusalem.{He {came back to Southwell to marry his {wife. He loves Southwell. }
